content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 53.1 - Stationing of pilot vessels at the entrance to New York Harbor

State Regulations

For the purpose of receiving pilots from outward bound
vessels and supplying pilots to inward bound vessels, the Sandy Hook pilots
shall station such pilot vessels at the entrance to New York Harbor, in the
vicinity of Ambrose Light Tower as may be required to provide adequate service. A pilot vessel or vessels will remain on station at all times except when, in
the judgment of the executive committees of the Sandy Hook pilot associations
during periods of extreme weather and after it is determined that there will be
no arrivals or departures, it is deemed prudent to shift to more sheltered
waters. It shall be the duty of the crew of any pilot vessel on station to
render every necessary aid to pilots boarding and leaving
vessels. Notes
